alert.note: Alert for Perry (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 8:02PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following county, Perry. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 802 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richton, Beaumont, New Augusta, Ferguson, Wingate, Mahned, Hintonville, Oak Grove, Belleville, Little Creek, McSwain, Janice, Progress, Barbara, Indian Springs, East Side, Corinth, Runnelstown, Brewer and Good Hope. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
